Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump will be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

If both conditions are satisfied, the answer is **Yes**; otherwise, it is **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that (a) Vivek Ramaswamy will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump will face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

If both criteria are met, the answer is **Yes**; if not, it is **No**.

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that OpenAI will release a public report detailing the findings from an external red-team assessment of their models' safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI makes available a *public* report that includes the outcomes from an *external* entity's red-teaming evaluation concerning the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will Anthropic publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Anthropic will release a report detailing the findings from an external safety red-team assessment of their models by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **YES** if, on or before June 30, 2024, Anthropic issues a *public* report that includes the findings from an *independent* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will both OpenAI and Anthropic publish reports with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, both of the following occur: (a) OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models, and (b) Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI and Anthropic both release public reports detailing the findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be resolved as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, the following conditions are met: (a) OpenAI issues a *public* report containing the findings from an *external* party that conducted red-teaming on the safety of one of their AI models, and (b) Anthropic issues a *public* report containing the findings from an *external* party that conducted red-teaming on the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or be unable to proceed with his campaign before the clock strikes midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he remains in the race, then the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** outcome. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 (b) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition is met. 
(b) Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race before July 20 (b) Hurd becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The condition is satisfied if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. 
(b) Hurd must be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The nominee is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if credible sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties applicable to the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before July 5, 2024.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identifiable Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two secure-seat members have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local news outlets that they’ve already dismissed Biden’s chances for a victory in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one would request that Biden conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five identifiable Democratic Party US House Members or Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur by signing a letter as mentioned above, but it could also take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting that he withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet this market's criteria unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In any uncertain cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) The European Union declares new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (b) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators press Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if a coalition of a minimum of five identified Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborates to urge Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter or another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request that he withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals separately expressing to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the conclusion of this market. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Will the New York Knicks be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry concludes with a **Yes** if the New York Knicks secure the title in the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It concludes with a **No** if any other team wins or if the Knicks are not in the running.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Will the Miami Heat be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Miami Heat is declared the winner of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

A **No** answer will be given if another team wins the championship or if the Miami Heat is removed from the race.

question.title: Will both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** only if both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat are crowned champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). Since only one team can be crowned champion, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat both set to become champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry concludes as **Yes** solely if the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat both receive the title of champions for the 2024 NBA Finals, as stated by [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). Given that only one team can achieve the championship, this question will result in **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden stays in the position of US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution, as the Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Important: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that on July 15 he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(b) Resolves YES if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Resolves NO if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Biden continues as President until the end of July 2024 (b) Trump is either removed or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This resolves to YES if Biden is still the U.S. President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President as per the Constitution).

(b) This resolves to YES if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial communications will not be adequate for resolution. It resolves to NO if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. The question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might take place after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then later reinstated, leading to him not being removed or blocked from any ballot as of July 15th, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any ambiguity regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not released before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following events will take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden will be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 2 and does not exceed 3 points on July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Greece going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Greece competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Greece fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Lithuania going to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Lithuania fails to qualify, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Greece and Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Greece or Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Greece and Lithuania both set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Greece takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Greece or Lithuania fails to qualify, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast dated July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden, according to the same FiveThirtyEight forecast for July 19, 2024. Should both candidates possess identical probabilities, the market will resolve at a 50-50 outcome.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any adjustments in the methodology utilized by FiveThirtyEight to compute its statistics will not influence the outcome of this market.

The resolution will be based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. This market may remain unresolved until the data for July 20 is provided. In the event that no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a figure out of 100, rounded to one decimal point (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris choose either Kelly or Shapiro as her Vice Presidential candidate (YES), or someone else entirely (NO)?
para_P.body:
The leading contenders for Kamala’s Vice Presidential selection are presently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. Reports indicate that Kamala will make her decision before August 7th.

This market will conclude with a YES if and when Kamala Harris declares her choice for running mate to be either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

Conversely, it will resolve to NO if Kamala Harris announces a different individual as her running mate.

I will await confirmation from Kamala herself to finalize this.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) FiveThirtyEight project Joe Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris announce her VP pick as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?
question.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight will project Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to their election forecast for July 19, 2024. This will be determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast page. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. Changes in methodology by FiveThirtyEight will not affect the resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.

(b) Kamala Harris will announce her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The resolution will be based on Kamala Harris's own confirmation of her VP pick. If she announces anyone else, this will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) FiveThirtyEight indicates Joe Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris reveals her choice for VP to be either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?
para_P.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight will indicate that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on their election forecast for July 19, 2024. This will be assessed by the statistics shown by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast page. If Biden and Trump are viewed as equally likely to win, this will be resolved as a 50-50 outcome. Any changes in methodology by FiveThirtyEight will not influence the resolution. If there are no data points for July 19 available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest prior data to July 19 will be utilized.

(b) Kamala Harris will disclose her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The resolution will depend on Kamala Harris's own announcement of her VP selection. If she names anyone else, this will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** outcome. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

For a **Yes** determination, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution, as the Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is President or Acting President of the US before July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) This question resolves to "Yes" if Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves to "No" if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a "Yes" resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Kamala Harris serves as President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden continues to be the US President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, along with a consensus from reliable news reporting.

(b) This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if Joe Biden remains in office as US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). It will be classified as "No" if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary shift of power under the 25th Amendment, which appoints his Vice President as Acting President, will not result in a "Yes" resolution, as the role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution.

(b) The response will be **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Conversely, for the question to resolve as **Yes**, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the VP for the Democrats?
para_P.body: Should Kamala Harris receive the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidency, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if another individual is chosen for the VP position, the market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can reach a conclusion right after the nomination.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur:

(a) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President (VP). If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this condition will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this condition.

If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will Kamala Harris be chosen as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following take place:

(a) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and final, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice President (VP). If Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic VP, this condition will resolve to yes. If another individual is appointed as VP, this condition will resolve to no. Any changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this condition.

If either condition (a) or (b) is not satisfied, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will both Czechia and Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

If either Czechia or Georgia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Czechia and Georgia set to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

If either Czechia or Georgia fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France achieve a Top 5 finish in the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties will be regarded as affirmative) during the Olympics scheduled for 2024. It will be deemed unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by aggregating the total medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. Count of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Count of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Count of Bronze Medals

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market cap exceed that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if, as of July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a collective of at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local news agencies that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several versions of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one is intended to urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will determine a YES outcome if a collective of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as indicated above, or through other means such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively asking him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, it does not fulfill the requirements for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats communicating with Biden and requesting him to stand down will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are subsequently disclosed before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's? (2) Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(2) This question resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market cap surpass that of Apple, and will at least five Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, based on Companies Market Cap, as verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(2) This question will be considered YES if a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his 2024 re-election bid, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could manifest through a letter similar to what has been previously mentioned, or through another means such as a group engaging with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw. It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same collective communication. Five individuals independently expressing to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw will not suffice for a YES outcome. Any reports of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and requesting him to step down will not meet the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly prior to the market's conclusion. In cases of ambiguity where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and with **No** for all other political factions. In the event of a tie between two groups for seats, both will be considered as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media coverage.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA be the largest party following the 2024 elections for the European Parliament?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the European Parliament elections in 2024, and it will be answered with **No** for all other scenarios. In the event that two factions have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will both GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both the GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA political groups hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, meaning they are tied for the most seats. It will resolve as **No** if either group does not hold the most seats or if they do not tie for the most seats.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both the GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA political factions secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, indicating they are tied for the most seats. It will be answered with **No** if either faction fails to secure the highest number of seats or if they do not tie for that position.

The determination of this inquiry will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than an unnamed Democrat, will his support among Manifold respondents increase by at least 3%?
para_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls that will conclude on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about their choice of a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat included in the hypothetical polling either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the views of Manifold respondents reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are finalized.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) Trump increases his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to a generic Democrat, while facing Joe Biden, and (b) the value of USD reaches or exceeds 145 JPY at the end of trading on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) Two polls from Manifold will conclude on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote for Joe Biden in a hypothetical election, while the other asks them to choose a generic Democrat. Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in hypothetical scenarios tends to poll ahead or within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the views of the broader population? This market will be resolved as YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more upon their closure. The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4, based on 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which represents a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. Any other candidates will result in a **No** outcome. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may be included later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 presidential election; the determination is based solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(2) This question will resolve as Yes if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but at most 4 according to 538's national polling average, and will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, exceeds 3 and is at most 4. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.

(2) This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a reputable news source report on it no less than 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if a major and trustworthy news organization, such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post, reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be deemed adequate.

This market will be classified as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This question will be marked YES if a major and trustworthy news organization, such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post, reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his official announcement through a letter, speech, etc. This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.
