(2) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) enters into a political partnership with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative elections in France; (b) The Prime Minister of France is affiliated with a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) An electoral alliance or coalition agreement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is officially declared by June 30, 2024, as per reliable sources. If such an agreement is not announced, this condition is **No**. (2) The political party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to trustworthy sources. If both criteria are fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden is the opponent rather than a typical Democrat, will Trump receive a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls that will close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote for Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in this hypothetical scenario either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are finalized.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the result for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll includes Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat. This resolves YES if Trump's votes in poll 1 exceed poll 2 by 3% or more, based on the formula: (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). Otherwise, NO.

(b) This resolves YES if credible sources report Trump has testified, in person or remotely, at the trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump receives at least a 3% increase among Manifold respondents when compared to Biden versus a generic Democrat, (b) Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(a) There are two polls from Manifold that conclude on July 6. One poll features Joe Biden, while the other includes a generic Democrat. This will be considered TRUE if Trump's percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more, calculated using the formula: (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If not, it will be FALSE.

(b) This will be considered TRUE if reliable sources indicate that Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Core CPI in the US rises by more than 0.1% from June to July 2024 (b) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The resolution will rely on the data found at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will consider the exact (not rounded) figure.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Ireland fails to qualify, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Poland and Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Poland and Ireland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Ireland fails to qualify, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or be unable to proceed in the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, the outcome of this market will be yes. If not, the outcome will be no.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been formally excluded or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may take place after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump is excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the outlined criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If this occurs, this condition is satisfied.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This condition is satisfied if the removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this condition is not satisfied.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for the overall question to be answered affirmatively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign prior to July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. This condition is fulfilled if this event occurs.

(b) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This condition is satisfied if the disqualification or barring is confirmed through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry specifically concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds by July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, this condition is not fulfilled.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be met for the overall question to receive an affirmative response.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither seek nor accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** determination, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not provided by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Chasiv Yar be under Russian control by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall into any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Declared Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian dominance over the area



The inquiry will conclude with a **No** if the area is not categorized as under any of the classifications denoting Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Declared Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian dominance over the area.

If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND will Russia have dominance over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official declaration that he will not pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. If either of these criteria is not met, this inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of Scotland conducting an official referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Scotland conducts a referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom before the date of May 3, 2024. This referendum could be classified as an "advisory" referendum; it is not required for it to have any legal authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved if it is a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has not granted approval for the vote, nor if it is organized by civil society groups. The referendum must have the approval of the London government.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a trustworthy news organization report the incident at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a YES if a major and reputable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy sites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not meet the criteria.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the individuals currently discussed; additional candidates may emerge later.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The first part resolves YES if a major and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This part resolves as N/A if Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The second part resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden were to withdraw, would a trustworthy news source report the event at least 6 hours prior? Additionally, will Donald Trump Jr. be the candidate for the Republican party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The first component is considered YES if a prominent and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on President Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he makes an official announcement through a letter, speech, etc. This part is marked as N/A if Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The second component is deemed YES if Donald Trump Jr. is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based on who the delegates of the Republican National Convention choose, rather than who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will Inflection release a report detailing the findings from an independent red-team assessment of their models' safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report that includes the findings from an *external* organization red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to users in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other cases.

Here, "accessible" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is the ability to use it without needing a VPN (though it may involve a fee). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome if more than 50% of the population can access it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of these events take place: (a) Inflection releases a report detailing the results from an external assessment of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Inflection, this inquiry will be resolved as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report showcasing findings from an *independent* entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question will be resolved as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Broadly accessible" here indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (though it may require a subscription). If it is not available in some EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or restricted to certain groups (such as minors), this will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) Biden will withdraw if he leaves the race or is unable to continue prior to July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. If he stays in the race past this deadline, the answer is No.

This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates have equal chances, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures shown by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methods used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as information for July 20 is released. It may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is available. If July 19 data is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest prior data to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning odds for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The count of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following two events to happen: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) on July 19, 2024, 538 predicts Biden as the frontrunner?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

1. Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will be determined exclusively by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, particularly the figures shown by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution of this market.

The outcome will be **No** if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or reputable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be considered "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the outlined criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry resolves in the negative.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has officially been barred or excluded from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This ban or exclusion must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative accounts, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be considered sufficient for resolution. The question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may happen after the specified date. question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is an official statement regarding Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden dies before July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following events to take place: (a) Biden being officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden passing away before July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(b) This will be considered YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If not, it will be NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on the lead that Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden will be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure suggests Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, resulting in a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) This inquiry will be resolved based on data from the St. Louis Fed available here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democratic Party experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then the answer will be **No**.

(b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, it is confirmed that 10 or more Democratic Senators have made this call, the market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: Is it possible for 24 or more world records to be shattered at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the total of world records broken at the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or exceeds that number.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France finish among the top 5 in the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties will be counted as positive) during the Olympics occurring in 2024. It will be deemed uncertain if the Olympics do not happen in 2024.

The ranking of the medal table is determined by the total count of medals earned by each competing nation, arranged by:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties in Gold) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties in Silver) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records are broken and (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body:
(a) At least 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving as **Yes** if the count is 24 or greater.

(b) France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving positively if France is in the top 5 (ties included) based on the medal count calculated by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. Number of Silver Medals (if Gold is tied)
3. Number of Bronze Medals (if Silver is tied).

The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A minimum of 24 world records are established and (b) France finishes in the Top 5?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 24 world records are established during the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving as **Yes** if the total is 24 or more.

(b) France finishes in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving positively if France is among the top 5 (including ties) based on the medal tally determined by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. Number of Silver Medals (if Gold is tied)
3. Number of Bronze Medals (if Silver is tied).

The question remains unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball during the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will resolve to Yes if Team USA achieves gold in both events. It will resolve to No if either the men's or women's team does not finish in first place.

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

It will result in a **No** for any other teams that do not succeed in the finals.

question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and (2) the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. It resolves No if either or both of these conditions are not met.

A No response will occur if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Is the Pandemic Agreement going to receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following conditions are met:

- OpenAI makes a public declaration regarding the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement issued by the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a comment made during an interview). The communication from OpenAI must demonstrate a new level of commitment to the principle compared to the time when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply reiterate that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact specific signatories or endorsers to evaluate their level of contentment with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as robust as "this was a positive initial step" for this inquiry to conclude as **Yes**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly (2) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this condition to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) The Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024 (2) OpenAI makes a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. The Pandemic Agreement is voted on and approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), based on reports from reliable sources.

2. OpenAI publicly announces its commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, through a statement from the company or its representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote in an interview). The statement must demonstrate a new level of commitment to the principle compared to the time when the righttowarn.ai statement was issued; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism." Furthermore, Metaculus must confirm that at least one member of righttowarn.ai is satisfied with the company's acceptance of the principle. Metaculus may contact certain signatories or endorsers to evaluate their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for this condition to be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

To achieve a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should not allow for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Reliable users are encouraged to resolve this market early if the result is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report issues.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the US federal government terminate its arrangement that permits Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally cancels or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which acknowledges Verisign's control over the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (b) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding the management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement prior to July 15, 2024, stating he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (b) The US government concludes its contract with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This is considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for a second term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, eliminating any possibility of accepting the nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this will be deemed No.

(b) Will the US government terminate its agreement that allows Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024? This is considered Yes if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially ends or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign concerning the management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not occur, this will be deemed No.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% from June to July?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% in comparison to the figure from June 2024.

The data for making this determination will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: By June 1, 2024, will Russia possess dominance over Chasiv Yar?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area



The inquiry will conclude as **No** if the site is not evaluated to be in any of the classifications denoting Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any additional classifications established by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the area or an absence of Russian control of the area.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location
