- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Will Russia gain control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024? (b) Will Donald Trump be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, when reviewed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the following classifications:

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine
- Evaluated Russian Acquisitions in the Last 24 Hours
- Evaluated Russian Authority
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian authority over the area

The inquiry will be marked as **No** if the area is not classified in any of the categories signifying Russian authority, which includes but is not limited to:

- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Acquisitions in the Last 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities
- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Ukrainian authority over the area or a lack of Russian authority over the area

(b) This inquiry will be marked as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on the provisions of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prevention is validated through official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not be sufficient for resolution. The inquiry will be marked as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur *after* the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified provisions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge in the future.

For this question, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive at least a 3% increase in support among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes including Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on that same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the views of the broader public?

This market will be marked YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until their designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is nominated on the day of the election.

(b) There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks them to vote with a generic Democrat. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Joe Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference in percentages between the two polls is >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following conditions will happen: (a) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) When competing against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, Trump secures at least a 3% advantage among Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen as the nominee by the Republican National Convention. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, independent of who is nominated on election day.

(b) There are two Manifold polls that conclude on July 6. One poll asks participants to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about a generic Democrat. This question will be answered YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Joe Biden poll is at least 3% higher than in the generic Democrat poll when both polls finalize. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the percentage difference between the two polls is >= 0.03. Otherwise, it will be NO.

This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. Future candidates that may be introduced will also be taken into account.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(b) The question about Donald Trump will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The resolution regarding the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be based on data from the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the value reported on July 20, 2023.

(b) The resolution concerning Donald Trump will be marked as **Yes** if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This inquiry may take into account any new candidates that may emerge in the future. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the decision is strictly based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market's closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed a NO.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is the head of the Secret Service expected to step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is it anticipated that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to hold the position of director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday and that the head of the Secret Service will step down in the following 90 days?
para_P.body: This will be considered TRUE if both of the subsequent events take place: (a) there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the U.S. Secret Service Director, resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason ceases to be the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024. If not, it will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves identically to the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a conclusive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be marked as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be applied to this market automatically. Users who are considered reliable are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or report issues.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, and will there be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention? This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if both (a) and (b) resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare he will not pursue the Democratic nomination prior to July 15, 2024, and will there be an additional Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:
(a) Is there a chance that Joe Biden will officially declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive, leaving no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this will be considered No.

(b) Is there a likelihood of another Democratic party presidential debate occurring before the 2024 Democratic National Convention? This will be considered Yes if a debate takes place among potential Democratic candidates (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. This will be considered No otherwise.

The overall question will be considered Yes if both (a) and (b) are answered Yes.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing findings from external red-teaming of their models regarding safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question for Google DeepMind will be resolved as **YES** if they issue a *public* report by June 30, 2024, containing the findings from an *external* entity that has assessed the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "accessible to the general public" means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (possibly requiring a subscription). If it is not available in some EU nations (as experienced in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the populace can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers specifically to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. If unavailable in certain EU countries or to minors, it resolves positively if >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website changes.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) a report from Google DeepMind detailing findings from external safety assessments of their models is published, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) In the case of Google DeepMind, this will be deemed **YES** if they release a *public* report by June 30, 2024, that includes the findings from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this will be considered **YES** if, on June 30, 2024, ChatGPT is broadly accessible in the EU. "Broadly accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN, and it may involve a fee. If it is not available in specific EU nations or for minors, it will still resolve positively if more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it will be considered a positive resolution if the service remains largely unchanged, even if the name or website undergoes alterations.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below prior to July 1, 2024. It will be deemed **No** in the absence of such action.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident happening in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
The resolution will be Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The resolution will be No if this does not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any authority of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, and (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). (2) A terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question will resolve as No if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) the ICC releases arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) a terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) The International Criminal Court (ICC) must issue a warrant for the arrest of any of the following Israeli government officials: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff) before July 1, 2024. (2) A terrorist incident must occur in Metropolitan France that injures and/or results in the death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. This incident must be classified as a 'terrorist attack' by any French state agency or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France. The resolution will be No if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3, based on 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview took place in April on The Howard Stern Show, where Biden responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will conclude with a YES if Biden participates in another in-person interview that lasts at least 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person for these appearances to be considered valid. For instance, a 50-minute video could contain only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each included less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

A list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts can be found here.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview/discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes, prior to the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) The latest qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for about 70 minutes.

If Biden takes part in another qualifying in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve as YES. If no such interview is made available before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve as NO.

This market does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview featured in a program like 60 Minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person for such instances to qualify. A 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not count.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will determine a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that Biden and Trump are shown to have equal chances, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will reach a resolution based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. The market may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is accessible. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate wins will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tim Scott is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for that date on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this resolves 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the resolution will use the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is it true that both (a) Tim Scott becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) FiveThirtyEight indicates Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Tim Scott is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This decision is made based on the delegates' selection at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the election in 2024.

(b) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. This assessment relies on the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for that specific date in FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. In the event that Biden and Trump are shown to have equal probabilities, the outcome will be considered as 50-50. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest preceding figures to July 19 will be used for the resolution.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value is Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Will Hurd be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Will Donald Trump give testimony in the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Hurd is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may be introduced later. For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold in the following eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- soccer 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have clinched at least two of these competitions for the answer to be **Yes**.

The resolution of this question can occur as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will transpire (for example, if neither team competing in the final of the last event has won any of the previous ones).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. 

(b) This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 
- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.
Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) A tennis player secures more than one medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) The same country achieves victory in more than one women's team event at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The answer to this question will be **Yes** if any tennis player earns at least two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympics. 

(b) The answer will be **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) each win gold in the following eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 
- soccer 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.
In all other cases, the same NOC must have secured at least two of these events, leading to a **Yes** answer.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA political group secure the highest number of seats following the European Parliamentary Elections in 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will result in **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament, and it will be **No** for any other results. In the event that two groups have an equal number of seats, both associated inquiries will be resolved as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reputable news sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024. This is based on the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but no more than 3 in 538's national polling average, and will the Greens–EFA have the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3. This determination is based on the figure displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, as checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates that Trump is leading.

2. The Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the European Parliament elections in 2024. This will be determined based on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is not made public, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency through death, resignation, etc. does not qualify. Biden utilizing section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Background: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden going to publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office. (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (1) Biden be deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024 and (2) Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination?
para_P.body: (1) Biden be deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the office of the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office. (2) Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination: This question will resolve as **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will result in a No answer if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions for the question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a Woman (b) The same nation will win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It will resolve “no” if/when they select a male nominee.

(b) The question about the 2024 Olympics will resolve as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it will resolve as Yes if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

para_P.title: Is it true that: (a) A Woman will be the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024 (b) The same country will achieve victory in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024 will yield a “yes” answer if a female candidate is chosen by the Democratic delegates for the presidential election. A “no” answer will result if a male candidate is selected.

(b) The question concerning the 2024 Olympics will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) secure gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Conversely, it will be answered with Yes if the same NOC wins at least two of these competitions.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) According to Nate Silver's model, Kamala's chances of winning will rise in the upcoming week, and (b) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve as YES if the probability of Harris in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will resolve as NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official public statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A drafted letter, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, presents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues remain profoundly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to suppress debate and, by sheer force, achieve unity, but that approach is ineffective,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he achieve a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to close on July 6. One poll solicits votes from Manifold participants for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests votes for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public sentiment surveys consistently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, yet every other Democrat in hypothetical scenarios polls either ahead or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents indicative of the overall population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second by 3% or greater at the time both polls close.

The percentage of votes for Trump is calculated using the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

These polls and this question will not resolve to N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?

1. A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes:
   - Donald Trump

   - Melania Trump
   - Barron Trump

2. In two Manifold polls closing on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in a poll with Joe Biden on the ballot exceeds the percentage in a poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The market resolves YES if the result from poll 1 minus the result from poll 2 is >= 0.03. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a Trump family member to be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024, and will Trump achieve at least a 3% lead among Manifold voters when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?

This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

   - Donald Trump
