   - Barron Trump

2. In two Manifold polls concluding on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in a poll featuring Joe Biden surpasses the percentage in a poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The calculation utilized is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The market will resolve YES if the outcome from poll 1 minus the outcome from poll 2 is >= 0.03. If not, it will resolve NO.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) utilize Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc. is not included. Biden's self-invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Background: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior chance of victory over Joe Biden according to the same forecast. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is released. It may not reach a resolution until the July 20 data is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the most recent data prior to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution will refer to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 AND will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Will Biden be officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024 AND will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not considered. (b) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. If Biden and Trump have the same odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the values shown by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its figures will not affect the resolution of this market. This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is available. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to remain president until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they contend suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice to resolve this market to YES.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, and will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate him early?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (2) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to meet the second condition. If either condition is not met, this question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024, and will there be a public letter signed by no fewer than 20 Democratic House or Senate members opposing the plan for his early nomination?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) As of 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States. (2) Before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024, a public letter against the early nomination plan is endorsed by at least 20 lawmakers from the Democratic Party, whether they are House Members or Senators. Additionally, multiple letters that collectively gather 20 signatures from lawmakers will also fulfill the second requirement. If either of these conditions is unmet, the answer to this question will be negative.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democrats will face a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the outcome will be **No**.

question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially scheduled, claiming it suppresses the vital ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 members from the House or Senate who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively have a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures, it would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. If these criteria are not met by market close, this does not occur.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) A minimum of 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the strategy to virtually nominate Biden ahead of time?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024: This will happen if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this does not happen.

(b) A minimum of 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the strategy to virtually nominate Biden ahead of time: This will occur if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a total of at least 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this does not happen.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question may take into account any new candidates that might emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who the Republican nominee is on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the BSE SENSEX finish at a value exceeding 75,000 but not surpassing 77,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry is determined by the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) On July 21, 2024, the final value of BSE SENSEX is above 75,000 and at most 77,000?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. New candidates introduced in the future may also be taken into account for this question.

For this inquiry, it is important to note that the determination of the Republican nominee is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) and not on who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The resolution of this question will depend on the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Iran's military action prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Iran undertakes a military operation on Israeli territory, within its airspace, or in its maritime zones from July 30 to August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Conversely, it will resolve to "No" if no such action occurs.

In this context, a "military operation" refers to any act of force carried out by Iran against Israel's land, air, or maritime areas (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility in Israel, this market will resolve to "Yes") and must be officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by credible reports. This definition encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval strikes, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers are excluded from this market's resolution.

Only actions by Iranian military forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian territory, will be considered for this market's outcome. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be factored into the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, and (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Donald Trump will provide testimony at the hush money trial, and (b) Iran will launch a military operation against Israeli land before August 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, regarding the trial about the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will be marked as "Yes" if Iran carries out a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. For this market's purposes, a "military operation" refers to any act of force executed by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime areas that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground incursions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not contribute to the resolution of this market. Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will be considered for the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy groups will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

para_P.title: Is Albania going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be confirmed as **Yes** if Albania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. It will be resolved as **No** for any other results concerning Albania.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Iceland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will both Albania and Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Albania and Iceland participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if either or both countries do not qualify for the Grand Final.

para_P.title: Are Albania and Iceland both set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Albania and Iceland take part in a Semi-final and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, it will resolve as **No** if either of the two nations fails to qualify for the Grand Final.

If either Portugal or Poland fails to qualify, the inquiry will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points over Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democratic Party need a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot is sufficient, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) will the Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude as Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for that date shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(b) This inquiry resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this inquiry resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher chance of winning than Joe Biden on that date. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market may not resolve until the data for July 20 is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest prior figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning odds for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate has won will not be taken into account.

question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 4, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the lead that Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump by FiveThirtyEight on July 19, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. It will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning than Joe Biden according to the same source for the same date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, it will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast available at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/. The relevant data is the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and changes in methodology will not affect the resolution. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used. The odds are reported as a number out of 100 to the 1 digit mark. (b) This question will resolve based on whether Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following conditions will happen: (a) FiveThirtyEight forecasts Joe Biden as the frontrunner against Donald Trump on July 19, 2024, and (b) on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is more than 2 but at most 4 according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will be answered with “Yes” if, according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast for July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump. Conversely, it will be marked “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher probability of winning than Joe Biden based on the same source for that date. If both candidates are seen as equally likely to win, the outcome will be 50-50. The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/. The relevant figures are those represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and any changes in methodology will not influence the resolution. If data for July 19 is unavailable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest prior data to July 19 will be utilized. The probabilities are expressed as a figure out of 100 to one decimal place. (b) This question will conclude based on whether Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates a lead for Biden.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

It will conclude as **No** for all other political factions. In the event that two factions are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This inquiry resolves based on [official declarations by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, the ID political group secures the highest number of seats, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be marked as **No** for all other political factions. In the event of a tie between two factions for seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**. (b) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved through a vote, according to reports from trustworthy sources.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden make a public statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves the same way as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will automatically apply to this market. Users with a degree of trustworthiness are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for requests regarding early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Meta publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (b) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Meta releases a report detailing findings from an independent red-team assessment of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (b) the associated market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta issues a *public* report with the findings from an *independent* entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) It will be considered YES if the market located at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has 377 traders prior to market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be marked as NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:

para_P.title: Is it possible that Elon Musk will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a YES if Elon Musk appears as a speaker on the main stage at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, a significant Bitcoin conference scheduled for July 25-27, 2024.

[image]

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

This question will be marked as "No" if these criteria are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or blocked from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both Elon Musk appear at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and Donald Trump be removed from any U.S. state primary ballot for a federal office under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024; (2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will both Elon Musk be present at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 event and will Donald Trump face disqualification from any U.S. state primary ballot for a federal position due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Elon Musk is featured as a speaker on the main stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is one of the largest Bitcoin conferences occurring from July 25-27, 2024; (2) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as verified by official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase in support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll solicits votes from Manifold participants for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for votes for a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat posed in hypothetical scenarios typically leads or is within the margin of error. Are Manifold participants reflective of the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from safe districts have already publicly called for Biden to exit. Additionally, two vulnerable Democrats have informed local news outlets that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five individuals knowledgeable about the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals deliver a unified message. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should step down, it will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed with high certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If the specified conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, and (2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat: 
There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks them to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th: 
Politico reports multiple drafts of letters among House Democrats, with at least one calling on Biden to end his campaign. This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In ambiguous cases, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (1) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% support among Manifold respondents when matched against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, and (2) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urges Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% support among Manifold respondents when matched against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat: 
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll inquires about Manifold respondents' votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while another seeks their votes for a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. This will resolve YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or more at the time both polls conclude. The calculation for determining the vote percentage for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if this calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urges Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th: 
According to Politico, there are several drafts of letters among House Democrats, with at least one requesting Biden to cease his campaign. This will resolve YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter or another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to step aside. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is inadequate for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least 5 qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the conclusion of this market. In uncertain situations, this market will lean towards resolving NO. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Moldova qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Moldova participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Moldova going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Moldova takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other scenarios, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Retain Its Majority Representation from Hungary in the EU for 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest contingent of Hungarian representatives in the European Parliament, as per reliable sources.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties applicable to the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 and (b) the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources; and (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Fidesz-KDNP continues to hold the highest number of EU seats from Hungary in 2024 and (b) the EU reveals new tariffs on electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) After the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains more seats than any other single party or coalition, thus retaining the largest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, as confirmed by reliable sources; and (b) Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared that new tariffs or duties will be implemented on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

para_P.title: Is Disney set to reveal a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024?
para_P.body: This will be considered YES if Disney reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. It will be deemed NO if it is mentioned in a "brainstorming ideas" context similar to how some attractions were addressed at the previous D23. It will also be NO if a Moana attraction is unveiled for a different theme park in Florida or any other location. Betting will close on August 8, the day before the convention. The outcome will be determined after the convention.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

para_P.title: Will the crossover film featuring Deadpool and Wolverine achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film? [surpassing Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
para_P.body:
Experts are forecasting a massive opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" collaboration movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

This film, helmed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is anticipated to rake in between $340 million and $360 million worldwide during its opening weekend. This would establish a new record for the largest opening weekend for any R-rated film. In the domestic market, the movie is projected to earn between $160 million and $170 million, which would make it the highest R-rated opening ever.

"""

[image]The current record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool, which earned $284.5M ($152.2M domestically).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will this new release surpass these figures? It seems it might be very close...

It will definitely be shown in more theaters... Deadpool was an unexpected blockbuster at the time.

Since BoxOfficeMojo has a peculiar way of reporting international opening weekends -- it presents the raw figures but aggregates them oddly -- we will await confirmation from the Hollywood Reporter regarding the weekend's earnings.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words, the BoxOfficeMojo figures should be regarded as unofficial until there is verification in the Hollywood press. The target number we are aiming for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024 AND will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question will resolve YES if BOTH of the following occur:
(a) Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. The announcement must be more than just discussing ideas, and must specifically be for the Magic Kingdom park, not any other park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. This part will be resolved after the convention.
(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The movie is expected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend, which would make it the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The current record is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million globally.

para_P.title: Will there be an announcement from Disney regarding a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024 AND will the opening weekend for Deadpool & Wolverine set a new record for R-rated films?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if BOTH of the following conditions are met:
(a) Disney reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. The announcement must go beyond mere idea discussions and must specifically pertain to the Magic Kingdom park, excluding any other parks in Florida or elsewhere. Betting will end on August 8, the day before the convention. This aspect will be resolved following the convention.
(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film achieves more than $284.5 million in global earnings during its opening weekend, as reported, AND it is confirmed by the Hollywood Reporter (or a comparable publication) as the highest-grossing opening for an R-rated movie. The film is anticipated to make between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend, which would set a new record for R-rated movie openings. The previous record is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million globally.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or be unable to proceed in the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, and (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.
(b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of these events happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race before July 20, and (b) Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign prior to midnight Eastern Time on July 20.
(b) Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 election.
