question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be answered with **No** for all other possible results. In the event that two factions are equal in the number of seats, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

This question will be determined based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media coverage.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the general public" means that the normal situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in some EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not available to certain groups (such as minors), it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The Greens–EFA political group must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats, and as **No** for all other outcomes. In case of a tie between groups, this resolves as **Yes**. Resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT must be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. This resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on that date, meaning the default state for EU residents is access without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. Availability issues in some EU countries or to certain demographics (e.g., minors) do not affect this, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface and resolves positively if the name or website changes, as long as the service remains substantially the same.

para_P.title: Are both of the following conditions satisfied: (a) the Greens–EFA will have the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The Greens–EFA political faction needs to possess the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will be considered **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction indeed has the most seats, and **No** for any other scenarios. In the event of a tie between factions, it will still be considered **Yes**. The determination is based on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT must be widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024. This will be marked as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on that date, which means that the standard situation for EU residents is access without needing a VPN, potentially requiring payment. Issues with availability in certain EU nations or for specific groups (like minors) do not impact this as long as more than 50% of the population can utilize it. The term "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface and will be deemed positive if the name or website changes, provided that the service remains fundamentally the same.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on June 28th, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses Apple's, based on the data from [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), as verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Nvidia's market capitalization will be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. On June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 in 538's national polling average, while Nvidia's market value surpasses that of Apple on June 28, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. According to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/), Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is recorded as greater than 2 and not exceeding 3 on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure denotes a lead for Trump.

2. On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, as per [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Israel will conduct a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports emerge indicating that an attack linked to Israel has taken place within Iran, resulting in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average; (b) Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

para_P.title: Will the critics' rating for "Twisters" (2024) on Rotten Tomatoes reach at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
para_P.body:
The Rotten Tomatoes page for "Twisters" (2024)

This will be considered YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or more, one week post-release (July 26th).

Details 

I will rely on the precision provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually an integer percentage, without decimals).

For instance, the original "Twister" (1996) has a current Tomatometer score of 63%. This will be the score I reference.

The term "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for context (to my knowledge, it requires a score of >=75% on the Tomatometer, but there may be additional criteria—the market resolves based solely on the visible score).

"Twisters" (2024) serves as a standalone sequel to the 1996 film, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings in the domestic market for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) surpasses $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% and will "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
1. "Twisters" (2024) will have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th), as displayed on the "Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page. The score will be taken as an integer percentage, with no decimals. "Certified Fresh" is used for illustrative purposes, but the resolution is solely based on the displayed score. "Twisters" (2024) is directed by Lee Isaac Chung and stars Glen Powell and Daisy Edgar Jones.

2. "Deadpool & Wolverine" will have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined if the domestic box office opening reported by Boxofficemojo is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013).

para_P.title: Is it true that "Twisters" (2024) will achieve a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of no less than 75% and that "Deadpool & Wolverine" will surpass the domestic box office opening of both "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
para_P.body:
1. "Twisters" (2024) will achieve a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of no less than 75% if the Tomatometer score is 75% or greater, one week after its release (July 26th), as shown on the "Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page. The score will be taken as a whole number percentage, without any decimals. The term "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for reference, but the determination is based solely on the displayed score. Directed by Lee Isaac Chung, "Twisters" (2024) features performances from Glen Powell and Daisy Edgar Jones.

2. "Deadpool & Wolverine" will exceed the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined if the domestic box office opening reported by Boxofficemojo is greater than $185,548,391, which is the total of the openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013).

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other individual being chosen will conclude as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently announced; additional candidates may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district, formerly represented by Bill Johnson, remain under Republican control in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official Ohio State source or declaration will be referenced. If the election does not take place prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that Tucker Carlson must be the candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson). Credible sources must report this victory, and in case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used to confirm the result. If no special election is held before January 1, 2025, this condition cannot be satisfied and the question is annulled.

If both conditions are satisfied, the answer is **Yes**. If either or both are not satisfied, the answer is **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Republican Party secures Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This indicates that Tucker Carlson must be the individual selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on the date of the 2024 US election.

2. A candidate representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly held by Bill Johnson). Reliable sources must report this win, and in instances of conflicting reports among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be utilized to verify the outcome. If no special election occurs before January 1, 2025, this criterion cannot be met and the question is voided.

If both criteria are met, the response is **Yes**. If either or both are not met, the response is **No**.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) expected to increase from July 20, 2023 to July 20, 2024?

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of Israel executing a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an assault credited to Israel has taken place within the territory of Iran, resulting in the fatalities of at least five people.

The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. (b) The question about Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be greater Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) The determination regarding the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is based on data from the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023. (b) The inquiry about Israel conducting a lethal strike within Iran will resolve to **Yes** if, after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible reports confirm that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran's territory resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Nikki Haley going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently known; additional options may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is only based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president at the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will determine a yes outcome if, at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Joe Biden will still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(1) Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(2) Joe Biden will still be president by the end of July 2024: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Joe Biden remains president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently in the running; additional options may emerge later. For this question, it does not matter who is nominated on election day in 2024; it is entirely based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(2) Joe Biden remains president until the end of July 2024: This market will resolve as yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden fall between 2 and 4, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as stated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, which Metaculus will review on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Vice Presidential candidate for the Democrats?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate. Conversely, if another individual is appointed as VP, the market will conclude with a no. Any subsequent change to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the outcome of this market. The resolution can occur right after the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 
(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Will the following two conditions be satisfied: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris is the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of these criteria are fulfilled: 
(a) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and at most 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, as viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead.
(b) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice President. If Kamala Harris is chosen for the role of Democratic VP, this market will confirm a yes. If another individual is appointed as VP, this market will confirm a no. Any changes to the VP position after the initial selection will not alter the resolution of this market. The market may resolve promptly following the nomination.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is Biden expected to hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden continues to be the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution, as the Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Ron DeSantis going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election. The determination is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) Biden continues as President until the end of July 2024, and (b) Ron DeSantis becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden stays in office as the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); the answer is NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment (which involves appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution).

(b) Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other contenders will be considered NO. The identity of the individual who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election is not significant. It is strictly based on who is chosen by the Republican National Convention delegates.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden takes part in another such face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve as YES. If no qualifying interview is available before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve as NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can encompass guest spots on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus it would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value was Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: (a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview, such as on a podcast or late night show, for at least 45 minutes of new footage, released before the end of July 2024. The interview should not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera for over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: (a) Joe Biden is required to participate in a face-to-face interview, such as on a podcast or late-night program, for a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage, which must be released before the end of July 2024. This interview should exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump must have a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to the national polling average from 538, as referenced by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they contend suppresses the critical ongoing discourse regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain significantly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve 21 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if the total gold medals won by Individual Neutral Athletes reaches 21 or exceeds that number during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The determination of the outcome will rely on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will be resolved to "No". 

If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have secured 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for condition (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, condition (b) will be considered met immediately.

para_P.title: Will there be a situation at the 2024 Paris Olympics where: (a) a tennis player secures more than one medal, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes achieve 21 or more gold medals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Any tennis player earns at least two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes together win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The determination for condition (b) will rely on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources in case the IOC's reporting is not available. Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, condition (b) will be deemed fulfilled immediately.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden fall between 2 and 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates Trump's lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's advantage. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

question.body: (a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question. (b) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average (b) Joe Biden remains president at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will determine the outcome based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for this question. (b) This market will affirmatively resolve if, at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Glenn Youngkin going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be considered **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this inquiry, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to 538's national polling average, and (b) will Glenn Youngkin be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with Yes if the difference in polling between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number signifies a lead for Biden.

(b) This question will be answered with Yes if Glenn Youngkin is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The outcome is determined exclusively by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be deemed TRUE if an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs prior to the market's closure on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) There is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. If both criteria are satisfied, the inquiry will be resolved as **Yes**; otherwise, it will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden prematurely?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's attempt to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination earlier than initially scheduled, claiming it suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend's assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain profoundly concerned about Biden's candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 members from the House or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice for this market to resolve to YES.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market's closing time, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This query will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House/Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule (b) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House/Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule: This will be marked as YES if a public letter against the early nomination initiative receives signatures from at least 20 members of the House or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters totaling 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice for this market to be marked as YES. If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, this market will be marked as NO.

(b) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This will be marked as YES if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is necessary, then this question will be marked as NO.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: During the 2024 Olympic Games, will five or more nations secure their first gold medal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if five or more nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve 15 or More Gold Medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 15 or more gold medals during the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reputable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will result in a "No".

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have earned 15 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games:

1. At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal, according to credible sources.
2. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this part resolves immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Is it true that during the Paris 2024 Olympics, (a) a minimum of 5 nations achieve their first Olympic gold medal and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes secure at least 15 gold medals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games:

1. A minimum of 5 nations earn their inaugural Olympic gold medal, as reported by reliable sources.
2. Individual Neutral Athletes together attain 15 or more gold medals. The resolution will rely on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other trustworthy sources. If it is established that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, this aspect will be resolved immediately with a "Yes".

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the Prime Minister of France's party is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the ID political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will conclude as **No** for any other political factions. In the event that two factions are tied for seats, both sub-questions will conclude as **Yes**.

This inquiry resolves based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024; (b) The ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. It will resolve as No if either or both of these conditions are not met. If two political groups are tied for seats, condition (b) will still resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will happen: (a) On July 30, 2024, the Prime Minister of France will be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together; (b) The ID political faction will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) The Prime Minister of France's party is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources. (b) The ID political faction has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, according to official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media coverage. It will be answered with a No if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled. In the event of a tie between two political factions for seats, condition (b) will still be considered a Yes.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and final: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Switzerland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value is Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election AND will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will Trump's margin over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, which is determined exclusively by the selections made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, as verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?

Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly recommending that Tesla shareholders vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If not, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will BOTH of the following occur: (1) the proxy advisor ISS advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk, AND (2) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) The first condition will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. (2) The second condition will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that BOTH of the following will happen: (1) ISS recommends that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's compensation package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk, AND (2) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) The first condition will resolve as **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If this does not occur, it will resolve as **No**.

(2) The second condition will be considered **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The outcome on the day of the 2024 US election does not influence this; it is determined solely by the decision made at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
