(b) Joe Biden holds the office of the president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden going to declare that he is withdrawing from the race and stepping down from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he will not pursue re-election and that he plans to resign, thereby not finishing his current term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time; however, he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position by the end of July. A declaration of his intention to do so will suffice for this market to resolve positively.

If he does not make these announcements, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this part.

Otherwise, this part resolves NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if the USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance is greater than or equal to 145 JPY. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Joe Biden declares his intention to withdraw and resign prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (b) the USD reaches a value of at least 145 JPY at the closing on August 9, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered TRUE if Joe Biden makes announcements stating that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from his position, not completing his current term. These statements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his office by the end of July. A declaration of his plan to do so is adequate for this part to be resolved positively.

If not, this part will be deemed FALSE on August 1st.

(b) This will be considered TRUE if the USD/JPY closing rate listed for August 9, 2024, on Yahoo! Finance is at least 145 JPY. If it is lower, it will be deemed FALSE.

Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.body: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any comments made about possible witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris will be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, but a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.
(b) Donald Trump will be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following events take place: (a) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) At any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, Kamala Harris will be officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States. The main source for this resolution will be official announcements from the US government, along with a consensus of reliable news reports.
(b) Donald Trump will be charged or indicted concerning any remarks related to possible witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. These charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to initiate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be deemed **No** if that does not occur.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and will the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Note that Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count, nor does Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as NO otherwise.
   - Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
   - Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
   - Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, and will the ICC release arrest warrants for any specified Israeli officials before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Prior to August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President cannot fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President to act as President. The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. It is important to note that Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply, nor does Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the Presidency.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) must issue an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli cabinet members. It will be considered negative otherwise.
   - Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
   - Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
   - Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Criteria for resolution

This question will be answered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be applied to this market automatically. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to ping @jskf to request an early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Chris Christie going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(b) Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Chris Christie will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(b) Will Chris Christie be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This will be considered Yes if Chris Christie is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the election day.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This decision is solely made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will be acknowledged as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invokes Section 4 to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his withdrawal and resignation from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will resign, thereby not finishing his current presidential term. These declarations must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time; however, he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated office by that time. A statement of his intention to resign is adequate to settle this market.

If not, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks made about possible witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this part of the question.

Otherwise, this part resolves NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden declares he is stepping down and resigning from the presidency prior to the end of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This part resolves to YES if Joe Biden publicly states that he is withdrawing from the race for re-election and that he intends to resign from his current presidential term. These statements must be made before the conclusion of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his office by that time. A declaration of his plan to do so is adequate to resolve this segment of the inquiry.

Conversely, this segment will resolve to NO on August 1st.

(b) This part resolves to YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will both Iceland and Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.title: Are both Iceland and Ireland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

If one or both fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s plan to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the ongoing critical discussions regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman mentioned during an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 signatures from lawmakers, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024? (b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President: This will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, but a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

(b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter: This will resolve to "Yes" if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures are sufficient. Context from Politico indicates that dozens of House Democrats are organizing against the plan to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than planned.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President by July 26, 2024? (b) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public statement opposing the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President: This will be considered "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, along with a consensus from trustworthy reports.

(b) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public statement: This will be considered "Yes" if a public statement against the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. It is sufficient for there to be multiple statements that together have a total of 20 signatures. Context from Politico suggests that numerous House Democrats are mobilizing against the plan to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than anticipated.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive at least 3% more support from Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll prompts Manifold respondents to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other invites respondents to vote with a standard Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these hypotheticals either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents indicative of the broader public?

This market will resolve to YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will remain open until the scheduled closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes, prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview was Biden's guest appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, during which he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden takes part in another such face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. 

This market does not encompass press briefings, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town halls, etc. It may include guest spots on a podcast or late-night talk show, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for these appearances to be counted. A 50-minute video might only showcase 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can access a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, so that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on podcasts or late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, but not press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this condition is not met.

(2) Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this condition is not met.

Both conditions must be met for the question to resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (1) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is eliminated or prohibited from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden needs to engage in a face-to-face interview for no less than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This encompasses appearances on podcasts or late-night television, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town hall meetings, etc. There must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showcasing Biden in an in-person interview. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this condition will not be satisfied.

(2) Donald Trump must be officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be validated through formal announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then subsequently reinstated so that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, this condition will not be fulfilled.

Both conditions must be satisfied for the question to be answered as YES.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Georgia set to make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Any other result will lead to a conclusion of **No**.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Georgia and Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Georgia and Malta participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both fail to qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Georgia and Malta set to advance to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both Georgia and Malta take part in their respective Semi-finals and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Should either or both not qualify, the outcome will be **No**.
